{bc}a function or part performed especially in a particular operation or process

a part played by an actor or singer

dt: {bc}to play the most prominent or important role in a movie, play, etc.

dt.t: an actor currently {wi}starring{/wi} in a hit Broadway show
She had a {phrase}starring role{/phrase} in his latest film.
Tequila and blood oranges {wi}star{/wi} in this Margarita, which gets a spicy kick from homemade jalapeño syrup.

dt: {bc}to feature (a performer) in the most prominent or important role

dt.t: a movie that {wi}stars{/wi} a famous stage personality
In the fall of 1925, Elkins {wi}starred{/wi} on the gridiron …
[Alan] Trammell, who {wi}starred{/wi} for the Tigers at shortstop during the glory days of the 1980s …

dt: {bc}to mark with a star as being superior or preeminent in some way
{bc}to sprinkle or adorn with or as if with stars

shortdef: to play the most prominent or important role in a movie, play, etc.
to feature (a performer) in the most prominent or important role
